discourse_list.title: [EXECUTIVE VOTE NOTICE] 3F Delegate Cannot Support an INCREASE of the GUSD PSM Debt Ceiling

content.content: The 10M DC was previously Maxed out–Today, 25-02-2022–it has less than 22,000 DAI Perhaps we should have spoken-up sooner(we did POLL NO), but we are lacking motivation in supporting the current Executive based on:  The Growth CU team has indicated to 3F Delegate that there are no deals in their pipeline associated with GUSD, but they do maintain an opened relationship w/Gemini Base on the comments above we believe that the GUSD PSM is not a priority for Gemini.  Pertaining to DeFi:  If you compare Curve’s exposure to GUSD in November 2021 to February 2022–not much has changed. Here’s an excerpt from the Risk CU Collateral Onboarding Risk Evaluation:    image1408×164 78.5 KB  Today Curve has 8.2% of GUSD Supply and Gemini is still at 54%  image1710×620 83.2 KB    We believe this product lacks Network Effects–Stablecoin sector has become super competitive.   If crypto(dot)com who spends millions in advertising/marketing has lost exposure to GUSD from holding 3% of the supply in November 2021 to 1.84% in February 2022–how can we be confident that the GUSD PSM will attract users?   We previously Polled NO to the Increase of the PSM-GUSD Debt Ceiling Poll - February 14, 2022  image1850×248 37.3 KB    We Request information with regards to the GUSD Smart Contract being upgradable/or not, so that blacklisting can be implemented/or not.    We Fully Support the @MakerMan Compensation We are 100% behind our fellow Delegate receiving the compensation that has been requested within the current Executive.  Request for Comments We ask the community to provide comments as to why it is important to increase the GUSD PSM DC.  Protecting the Hat is Priority One In the case we believe there’s more supply available in the open Market versus the HAT, 3F Delegate will prioritize the HAT over its believe that the GUSD PSM increase is not necessary.
content.GPT-summary: The post is an executive vote notice regarding the GUSD PSM debt ceiling. The author, 3F Delegate, explains why they cannot support an increase in the debt ceiling and provides reasons such as lack of motivation and network effects. They also request information about the GUSD smart contract and ask for comments from the community. The post contains constructive criticism of the proposal and explains the author's stance on the issue.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: just want to say that i like this post. I think the current trend of adding comments to huge Delegate forum posts really reduces visibility of your position on individual initiatives. I wish delegates would more regularly post in this manor.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: flipflopflapdelegate:  with regards to the GUSD Smart Contract being upgradable/or not   The contact can be upgraded, but see [GUSD] MIP6 Collateral Onboarding Application - #5 by monet-supply,    [GUSD] MIP6 Collateral Onboarding Application   I have spoken with a representative of Gemini BD, who confirmed Gemini currently has no plans to upgrade their token contract implementation.

GUSD seems as safe as USDC or USDP/BUSD. There are also little concerns that there will be market makers to arbitrage the price should it deviate from the peg. Therefore, the point is mainly on the fact that it is not used today (it was maxed earlier this month). Diversification on centralized stablecoins should be a goal for 2 reasons:  Having a standup alternative when needed. You can buy 99% of your good from one supplier because it’s cheaper, but it’s good to keep an alternative warm just in case. Avoiding reinforcing the USDC monopoly. We are not shareholders of Circle, don’t get any deal from them so we should help to level the playing field of CeFi stablecoins suppliers.  Let me show you to hint that the GUSD-PSM is helping. First, on the Dexes, since the PSM introduction end of November, the price deviation from the peg is lower and volatility of this deviation is lower as well.  image1285×516 40.9 KB  Secondly, from CoinGecko, you can see visually the stabilization mechanism from the PSM from the end of January which was when the PSM was really used.  image845×475 22.9 KB  You can follow from Etherscan that one Gemini is filling the PSM and a flash bot is using it to arbitrage the pools. You might say, well this is just helping Gemini, they should pay for it. I would argue that it is in our strategic interest. First helping them is giving us an alternative to USDC. I don’t care about nickels and dimes here. But there is way more at stake. Looking at the trades, I have the feeling that Gemini uses the PSM when they are doing an OTC GUSD-DAI trade for a client (the numbers are quite random) or to arb the price on their exchange. If that is correct (which is what @tylerwinklevoss  said in Gemini PSM application), this is a great way to provide DAI liquidity and competitiveness to a major CeFi hub at no cost. I would advise MakerDAO to increase the DC and Gemini to target a utilization rate of 50% (so it can work in both ways).
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: SebVentures:  Looking at the trades, I have the feeling that Gemini uses the PSM when they are doing an OTC GUSD-DAI trade for a client (the numbers are quite random) or to arb the price on their exchange.   What you’re describing here is a manual process for Gemini—and as I indicated above it’s perform “every now and then”. Automating it is an option—are they inspired to take that step? Only they can decide. Appreciate your input. TY!
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback

content.content: I want to offer an argument in favor of voting for the executive. In my view the on-chain polls are the place to voice support or opposition for any given proposal. Even if the vote goes against the conviction of the delegate, it is my opinion that every delegate should support an executive that does not constitute a likely chance to actively damage the protocol. Withholding support for an executive will harm the governance process and delay needed changes. I believe every delegate should respect the combined will of the community as represented by the result of the vote of the on-chain polls.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: May I ask what is the harm and/or significant opportunity cost to increasing the GUSD PSM debt ceiling? Diversifying issuer risk among high quality stablecoins in the PSM should be a top priority. Gemini fits the bill! The immediate situation of low utilization does not concern me other than to demonstrate that we need a strategic effort to strengthen the relationship. This increase will serve as a signal to the market of our priorities and focus in this regard.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
